Articles.Content: Can you use hinges to make  a plane switch between super maneuverability and speed. I need this for a fighter type thing
Yeah, servos have way higher torque.  Even then, wing changes are really unstable for me, as the stock joints are absurdly weak.  KJR fixes most of those problems though.
Are you talking about variable geometry planes? Yes, people make those. Look around the craft exchange subforum.

If you used them to switch a wing from a long, straight winged design to a more streamlined swept design I bet you could make it happen, but it'll take a lot of trial and error to find a wing shape that works for both and an angle that can make it happen.
